did.abstract: Township record books, 1845-1902; registers of births, 1906-1943; registers of deaths, 1897-1912; poll books, tally sheets, and statement of votes from polls within township; records relating to surveys, repairs, etc. of township roads; reports and compiled statistics pertaining to township schools; property assessment roll books; and other miscellaneous records.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The record group was received from the township office (donor no. 9467) in May 2004.

accessrestrict.p: The record group is open to research.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Ann Arbor Township Records, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

scopecontent.p: The records of Ann Arbor Township include township record books, 1845-1902; registers of births, 1906-1943; registers of deaths, 1897-1912; poll books, tally sheets, and statement of votes from polls within township; records relating to surveys, repairs, etc. of township roads; reports and compiled statistics pertaining to township schools; property assessment roll books; and other miscellaneous records. The records are organized into nine series:

Township Record Books includes minutes of annual and township board meetings. Also variously includes election results; motions and agreements; oaths of office; reports of Highway Commissioners' and minutes of the Board of Health.)

Registers of Births records babies born in (or registered) in the Ann Arbor township. Information in each entry includes place and date of birth; the infants name, sex, birth order, and legitimacy; the father's and mother's name, residence, race, age, birthplace, and occupation; as well as a certification of the attending physician or midwife and the date of registration.)

Registers of Deaths records deaths Ann Arbor township residents and other deaths that occurred in the township. Information includes place and date of death; the name of the deceased and often his sex, date of birth, age, marital status, age at marriage, number of children, birthplace, name of father, his birthplace, maiden name of mother, her birthplace, occupation of deceased and name of informant; as well as the cause of death, a certification of a physician or coroner, and the date of registration.)
Election records include a variety of poll books, poll lists and voter registration books documenting the electoral process and election results in Ann Arbor Township.

did.unittitle: Poll Books, Tally Sheets, And Statement Of Votes
Official Bonds And Oaths Of Office 1908-1942 (scattered)

odd.p: (Information includes date of enrollment, enrolled number, name, address, party affiliation and remarks. The 1906-1910 volume includes age, nativity, and race.)

scopecontent.p: Highway Records include proceedings of the Commissioners of Highways, descriptions of the highway districts, petitions and orders for road construction and repair, and road surveys.

odd.p: (includes annual reports of the Commissioners of Highways, petitions and orders, road survey records; and road repair vouchers)
(arranged alphabetically by name; appears to be an index to a record book of work done on roads)

scopecontent.p: The Treasurer's records, arranged by type of fund; include accounts of contingent fund, highway fund, road repair fund, and school funds
The School Records series, 1840s-1930s, files of the Board of School Inspectors annual statistical reports of school districts 1890s-1920s and miscellaneous reports.

did.unittitle: Annual Statistical Report Of School Districts, ca. 1890s-1920s
Township Clerk's Annual Report Of School Districts, ca. 1910s-1920s

odd.p: (includes uniform annual statistics for each school district. Information includes student census; financial accounts; and number of graduates)
(includes school orders and vouchers; apportionments for school districts; school inspectors reports; school district directors reports; and school census reports.)

scopecontent.p: The Miscellaneous records series a registry of Marks and Estrays, 1827-1834 (brands used to mark cattle and sheep); a Record of Strays (stray livestock and the damage they caused), Chattle Mortgage records, 1830s-1920s; and an assortment of petitions, meeting notices, and grand jury lists.

odd.p: (includes drawings of marks (brands) for sheep and the name of the township resident registering the mark)
(includes notarized accounts of damages or costs incurred by stray sheep and cows; includes slight board of health material at end of volume)

did.unittitle: Supervisors report of dogs in assessing district 1918

odd.p: (includes a list of orchards examined and the percentage of trees affected by the disease)
(includes receipts for bounties paid on sparrows)
(Includes name of mortgagee and mortgagor and dates of the mortgage)

did.unittitle: Various unprocessed records, including notices of meetings, sundry petitions, grand jury lists, contracts, etc.
Various unprocessed records, including notices of meetings, sundry petitions, grand jury lists, contracts, etc.

scopecontent.p: The Assessment Roll Books record real and personal property valuations from 1872 to 1996. Information includes name of owner; legal description of property; number of acres in parcel; value of parcel; value of personal estate; and amount of tax assessed for state, county, township, highway, and special purposes; volumes after 1960 were sampled on an every other year basis.
